item.title: Sensory Overload: My Experience at TeamLab
item.description: Thinking about the intersection of digital art, accessibility, and human emotion.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hello, I’m Bai Xueyi.

I am currently a Master of Data Science student at Monash University, expecting to transition into the Research Stream in 2026.

My academic journey began in the abstract world of Mathematics, but my passion lies in grounding those theories to solve human-centric problems. I describe my work as sitting at the intersection of Data Science and Human-Computer Interaction (HCI).

What drives me?

I have a deep interest in Digital Culture and Accessibility. Visiting TeamLabâ€™s immersive exhibitions was a turning point for meâ€”it solidified my belief that technology shouldn’t just be smart; it should be emotional and inclusive.

Bachelor of Science (Mathematics)

  • Background in pure mathematics, providing a strong foundation for algorithm analysis and statistical modeling.

ðŸ’» Selected Projects

1. Inclusive Museum Experience for the Blind

Ongoing Research Project

  • Context: Designing a multi-sensory interaction model for museum exhibitions.
  • Tech Stack: Python, Data Sonification, HCI methodologies.
  • Goal: To translate visual artistic elements into auditory signals, allowing low-vision visitors to “hear” the artwork.

2. Maternal Health Outcome Prediction

Coursework Project
